titleStmt.title: The twelve moneths, or, A pleasant and profitable discourse of every action, whether of labour or recreation, proper to each particular moneth branched into directions relating to husbandry, as plowing, sowing, gardening, planting, transplanting ... as also, of recreations as hunting, hawking, fishing, fowling, coursing, cockfighting : to which likewise is added a necessary advice touching physick ... : lastly, every moneth is shut up with an epigrame : with the fairs of every month / by M. Stevenson.
titleStmt.author: Stevenson, Matthew, d. 1684.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by M.S. for Thomas Jenner,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
